isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - INTRODUCTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: This International Service Manual Section describes the correct service and repair procedures for the Watson & Chalin lift axles available on the truck models listed on the front cover. The information contained in this manual was correct at the time of printing and is subject to change without notice or liability.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; when removing any component attached to the lift axle air tank, be sure to drain all air from the axle tank to prevent bodily injury. (This will also drain the air from the supply reservoir.) Draining of the primary and secondary reservoirs is not required since they are protected by check valves.
To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; no welding of any of the suspension components is permitted, except where specified in the manufacturer's documentation.

To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; do not weld on, drill, or bolt through the bottom flange of the suspension frame rail or truck rail. Check with chassis manufacturer for their warranty disclaimer on vehicle frame modifications.
To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; no alteration of any of the suspension components is permitted.
To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; proper axle attachment is required.

To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; set all UP/DOWN switches to the UP position before enabling the system (pressing the AXLE ENABLE switch). If any axle UP/DOWN switch is in the DOWN position when the ignition is switched off, the axle controlled by that switch will automatically raise to its up position. Enabling the lift axle system with an axle UP/DOWN switch in the DOWN position will cause that axle to be immediately lowered. The position of the UP/DOWN switches should be checked carefully because the DOWN indicators on the switches are always unlit (in either switch position) until the system is enabled.

To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; be aware of the Auto-Lift in Reverse feature on trucks with self-steering lift axles. On trucks with self-steering lift axles, any axle that is in the DOWN position when reverse is selected, will automatically raise to its UP position; AND that axle will automatically return to the down position when the transmission is shifted out of reverse.

caution.para: Do not change the size of the air tank(s). Alterations to production air brake systems must be approved by International Engineering prior to alteration or operation.
Always open a drain cock by hand. Never strike the handle with a hammer or any other instrument, as the cock will be damaged and leakage will develop.
Before drilling through the side of the frame rail, inspect the rail for any obstruction (fuel line, wiring harness, or air lines) that might be located on the inside of frame rail.

note.para: Auxiliary self-steering liftable air ride suspensions may require toe-in and caster adjustments.
